#plotting angular wavefunctions

Adapted from the quantum optics toolbox by Sze M. Tan

Shows a plot of an angular wave function corresponding to specified state of a l=3 system
{{{
from qutip import *

phi=linspace(0,2*pi,90)
theta=linspace(0,pi,45)

c2=basis(7,4) #2l+1

y=orbital(theta,phi,c2)
sphereplot(theta,phi,y)
}}}

http://qutip.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/sphereplot.png

Computes an approximation to a direction eigenket in the direct sum space of angular-momentum spaces
{{{
from qutip import *
L=2

theta = linspace(0,   pi, 180)
phi   = linspace(0, 2*pi,  30)

lmax  = 10

psi_list = []

for l in range(0,lmax+1):
    psi_list.append(sqrt((2*l + 1)/(4*pi)) * basis(2*l + 1, l))
psi = orbital(theta, phi, psi_list)
sphereplot(theta, phi, psi)
}}}

http://qutip.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/images/direction.png
